acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 96-hour LC50=230mg/L of fishes (Rainbow trout). (IUCLID, 2000)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rabbit LD50: >5000mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on rat LC50 value: 4000 - 8000ppm (ACGIH (2001)), it was classified as Category 5. (The saturated vapor concentration at 20degC is 3.2*10^(5) ppm)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 1850 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: DFGOTvol.19 (2003)

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on chemical pneumonia, though Dynamic viscosity: 0.434mm2/s.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was a statement of negative in percutaneous tests (PATTY (2001)), (DFGOTvol.19 (2003)). But there is no data of taking orally of of inhalation and there is also no information of evaluation organizations, such as IARC. So it was presupposed that it cannot be classified.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (aqueous solubility = 88200 mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: We found the negative result for the in vitro test (the Ames test, negative), however, we found no in vivo report. Therefore we presupposed that we could not classify it according to the technical guideline.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: It is the liquid with ignition points of 440 degC (ICSC (1998)), and it does not ignite in room temperatures.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There are statements of the moderate stimulativeness in the human exposure to vapor (HSDB (2005)), inflammation of a cornea by rabbit test (DFGOTvol.19 (2003)) and moderate stimulativeness (IUCLID (2000)). But there is no resilience data, and Category of 2A and 2B is not made. When a display is required, it is recommended to be set as 2A from a viewpoint of safety.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on descriptions that it has no stimulativeness on rabbits (DFGOTvol.19 (2003)) or on humans  (DFGOTvol.19 (2003) and IUCLID (2000)), it was classified as out of Category.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: It was put outside of the Category based on a statement of volunteering test indicating non-exsistence of the sensitization (IUCLID (2000)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 3 Narcotic effects, Respiratory tract irritation
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause respiratory irritation (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There are the description that there is anesthetic action, irritation to nose in human exposure (ACGIH (2001)), it is classified into Category 3 (anesthetic action, respiratory irritation). The symptoms which is reported in the animal test was seen out of the amount of the administration of the guidance value of the Category 2.
